p: Thymus albicans essential oil showed a broad spectrum antifungal activity. The oil was able to inhibit germ tube formation and biofilm integrity in Candida albicans, which are two key virulent factors of this highly prevalent etiologic agent of topical and invasive candidiasis in humans. In addition, at concentrations devoid of toxicity, Thymus albicans essential oil was able to reduce the production of the pro-inflammatory mediator NO. This anti-inflammatory effect was shown to be partly related to the reduction of iNOS levels.
